acquirerIntro.title: Who Can Be an
acquirerIntro.intro: Becoming an Acquirer is a significant step for merchants who wish to expand their payment processing capabilities and offer seamless transactions to their customers. An Acquirer is typically a merchant or organization that is responsible for processing card payments and managing merchant accounts.
acquirerIntro.requirement1: Merchant must have been operating for a minimum of 6 months.
acquirerIntro.requirement2: Merchant should have processed at least 100 transactions during this period.
acquirerIntro.requirement3: Maintain a good transaction record with minimal chargebacks or disputes.
acquirerIntro.requirement4: Provide valid business registration and compliance documents.
acquirerIntro.requirement5: Demonstrate the ability to manage payment settlements and reconciliation.
acquirerIntro.whyText: Becoming an Acquirer allows merchants to take control of their payment processing, improve transaction efficiency, and offer a better experience to their customers. It opens up new business opportunities and helps build trust with partners and clients.
acquirerIntro.benefit1: Direct access to payment networks and faster settlements.
acquirerIntro.benefit2: Enhanced security and fraud prevention tools.
acquirerIntro.benefit3: Ability to onboard and manage multiple merchants.
acquirerIntro.benefit4: Customizable payment solutions for different business needs.
acquirerIntro.benefit5: Detailed reporting and analytics for transaction monitoring.
acquirerIntro.benefit6: Priority support and dedicated account management.

acquirerRegWorkflow.title: Merchant Registration
acquirerRegWorkflow.subtitle: Registration Workflow
acquirerRegWorkflow.desc: The Sub-Acquirer Portal provides a structured, fully digital KYC and onboarding experience for merchants.

steps.title: Step 1: Merchant Basic Details
fields: Merchant ID: Automatically generated by the system. Alternatively, you may enter your own Merchant ID if preferred.
First Name / Last Name: Legal name of the merchant or business representative.
Mobile Number: With country code selector (e.g., +94 for Sri Lanka).
Email: Used for system notifications and login credentials.
Password: Temporary password to be used for initial login.
notes: Merchant email is auto-validated and disabled once submitted.
Merchant ID is unique and essential for traceability within SriPay, Alipay+, and reporting systems.

steps.title: Step 6: Business Contact Person

fields: The dashboard summary provides a real-time count of merchants and stores awaiting approval at each stage.

steps.title: Step 13: Sub-Acquirer Review and Decision

Reject: Opens a rejection model requiring a comment. Ensures transparent decision with reasons such as Invalid address, Mismatched document names, Incomplete contact information.

regBulk.title: Merchant Bulk Registration
regBulk.subtitle: Registration Workflow
regBulk.desc: This feature allows Sub-Acquirers to onboard multiple merchants simultaneously using a predefined Excel template.

steps.title: Step 1: Navigate to Bulk Registration area
points: Click the ‘Multiple Merchants’ button located next to ‘Create Merchant’.
A modal titled ‘Create new merchants’ will open.

steps.title: Step 2: Understand the Upload Model
points: Excel File Upload Area – drag/drop or browse to upload.
Download Sample Excel – click this to get the correct format.
Important Note – file must be .xlsx, and all images/documents must be preuploaded.

steps.title: Step 3: Download & Fill the Sample Excel
points: Click ‘Download Sample Excel’ to get the correct format.
Important Rules to follow when filling the excel file:
rules: Every row must contain valid entries for all columns.
Email must be unique and properly formatted.
Mobile number must follow a valid format (+94).
Ensure that all uploaded document URLs are publicly accessible to anyone with the link.

Since the merchant evaluation process involves multiple layers (Sub-Acquirer, SriPay, and Alipay), granting access restricted to a specific party would not be practical. Therefore, all uploaded document URLs should be publicly accessible to ensure seamless review across all approval stages.

steps.title: Step 4: Upload and Validate the Excel File
points: Click the upload box or drag your completed .xlsx file into it.

rows: Column headers in sheet ‘Merchant’ were modified...
No blank First Name, Email, etc.
Row 2: missing value for First Name
Excel file does not match the Sripay template

failPoints: A red error modal will appear showing the exact issue.
Click ‘OK’, fix the Excel file, and re-upload.

steps.title: Step 5: Upload Progress
points: You will see the message: ‘Uploading merchants…’
Wait until the process completes and the modal closes.

steps.title: Step 6: View New Merchants in Table
steps.desc: Newly uploaded merchants appear in the main table with
points: Status: acquirer-in-progress
Unique Merchant IDs
Email addresses and other details as per Excel

steps.title: Step 7: Proceed with Standard Evaluation Process
points: Appear in the merchant list.
Require: KYC Information, Document Uploads, Review & Submit
Flow through the stages - Acquirer In Progress → Sripay In Progress → Alipay-In Progress

storeViewAll.title: Merchant Store Management
storeViewAll.intro: The Merchant Store Management section allows Sub-Acquirers to manage the outlets (stores) under a registered merchant. Each merchant can have multiple stores, each with its own users and terminals. This section outlines how to view, create, and manage stores and their associated components.
storeViewAll.viewAllIntro: To access the list of all registered stores
viewAllSteps: Navigate to the "Stores" section from the left sidebar.
You’ll see a table listing all existing stores including
storeViewAll.filterText: Use filters to search by Merchant ID or Outlet ID.
storeViewAll.actionMenu: From the Action menu, you can
actions: Reject stores to move it to pending approval

regSelf.title: Merchant Self Sign-Up
regSelf.intro: The Merchant Self Sign-Up feature allows Sub-Acquirers to enable their merchants to register independently using a dedicated, branded sign-up link. This simplifies the onboarding process by eliminating the need for manual merchant creation from the Sub-Acquirer dashboard.

steps.title: Step 1: Send an Email Request
steps.desc: To activate this feature, you must send a formal request to SriPay to enable Merchant Self Sign-Up for your Sub-Acquirer account.
steps.subject: Request for Merchant Self Sign-Up Enablement
include: Preferred branding details (optional – logo, color theme)

steps.title: Step 2: SriPay Review & Enablement
points: SriPay will review your request and configure a custom sign-up URL.
The sign-up page will include your Sub-Acquirer’s name and branding colors.
You will be notified once the link is ready to be shared with merchants.

steps.title: Step 3: Merchant Access & KYC Submission
points: Merchants can use the self-registration link to:
Create their account
Submit KYC information
Upload required documents
All submitted applications will appear under your Sub-Acquirer Dashboard for review.

steps.title: Step 4: Proceed with Standard Evaluation Process
steps.desc: Once submitted, these merchants will follow the same approval flow:
steps.flow: Sub-Acquirer Review → SriPay Review → Alipay Review → Activation

benefits: Saves time for Sub-Acquirers by reducing manual entry.
Enables merchants to take ownership of their onboarding.
Ensures faster scaling for large merchant acquisition campaigns.
Fully integrated into the existing evaluation and compliance workflow.
regSelf.note: All merchant data collected through the self-sign-up page is secure and traceable under your Sub-Acquirer ID.

storeUserAssign.title: Assigning Store Users
storeUserAssign.desc: Store User Management allows the Acquirer to assign users specifically to a store. These users will be responsible for handling store-level tasks such as viewing transactions, accessing terminals, or processing orders depending on their roles.
storeUserAssign.instructionsTitle: To Assign users for a specific store:
steps: From the store list, click View (: > View) on the relevant store.
Navigate to the Add user to the outlet section inside the store profile.
storeUserAssign.note: Note: Store users should be added by the merchant before assigning them to a store.

storeCreate.title: Creating a New Store
step1: Go to the Merchants tab and locate the merchant for whom you want to create a store.
Click on the 3-dot action menu next to the merchant entry.
From the action menu, click Create Store to begin the process.
step2Fields: Store Name – The official name of the store/outlet.
Store Phone – Direct store contact number.
Store Email – Store’s email address for communication.
Province / District / City / Street – Physical location fields to map the store accurately.
Store QR currency – Select the preferred currency for your store’s QR code transactions.
Store Website – Include the store’s official website URL. If a dedicated outlet site is unavailable, you may use the main business website.
storeCreate.step2FieldsNote: These fields help ensure each store is uniquely identifiable by address and contact details.
storeCreate.step3Intro: To enable seamless settlement of funds, please provide your store’s bank account details. You may configure both Primary and Secondary settlement accounts. Only one account can be set as the default settlement account.
storeCreate.step3PrimaryDesc: This account will be used as the default for receiving settlement payments unless changed manually.
step3PrimaryFields: Bank Type: Choose between Local or International bank account.
Settlement Currency: Select LKR or USD depending on your account preference.
Bank Name: Choose your bank from the list provided.
Bank Code: Input the official bank code.
Branch Name: Enter the name of the bank branch.
Branch Code: Provide the correct branch code for reference.
Account Number: Enter the full bank account number used for settlements.
Account Name: Input the name under which the account is registered.
storeCreate.step3SecondaryDesc: This optional account acts as a backup for settlement purposes and can be activated when needed.
storeCreate.step3SecondaryFieldsTitle: Required Fields (same as Primary Bank Account)
storeCreate.step3SecondaryNote: You can also toggle the option to Set as default settlement account if you prefer this to be the primary method of receiving payments.
storeCreate.step3Note: Note: Ensure all information is accurate. Incorrect details may delay or reject settlements.
storeCreate.step3Next: Click Next to proceed once all mandatory details are entered correctly.
storeCreate.step4Intro: To finalize your store registration, please complete the following required details. This information helps verify and activate your store for customer-facing services and settlements.
storeCreate.step4FrontDesc: Upload clear exterior photos of your store front. This helps in authenticating the physical existence and visibility of the outlet.
storeCreate.step4FrontNote: Ensure the store name board is clearly visible in the image.
storeCreate.step4InteriorDesc: Upload clear interior photos of your store. This helps in verifying the operational nature and layout of your outlet.
storeCreate.step4InteriorNote: Make sure the images represent the actual setup of the store (e.g., counters, displays, signage).
storeCreate.step4MobileDesc: Provide a valid mobile number for store-level communication and verification.
step4MobileList: Click “Verify Phone Number” to receive and confirm a verification code.
storeCreate.step4EmailDesc: Enter a valid email address for official communications related to settlements, support, and notifications.
step4EmailList: Click “Verify Email” to authenticate the email before submission.
storeCreate.step4VerifyNote: Both phone and email must be verified before submitting the setup.
storeCreate.step4Submit: Click Submit once all fields are filled and verified to complete your store onboarding.
storeCreate.step5Intro: Once a store is submitted, it enters the Pending Requests stage for review and evaluation by the acquirer. The approval process ensures store legitimacy and compliance before activation.
storeCreate.step5PendingDesc: On the Pending Requests page, acquirers can,
step5PendingList: View all outlet submissions categorized by their current status:
Track requests using columns for Store Name, ID, City, Status, and Submitted Date.
Use filters or search functionality to locate specific records.

Website, QR Currency, Channel Fee, and Commission Rate
step5EvalStorePhotos: Review uploaded Interior and Storefront photos to validate store presence.
step5EvalMerchantInfo: Merchant ID, Name, and Category (e.g., Retail, Restaurant)
step5EvalContactInfo: Option to Set as Top Outlet (if applicable)

Send for Sripay Approval

storeCreate.step6Confirm: Click Confirm to finalize your selected action.

terminalManagement.title: Terminal Management
terminalManagement.desc: Terminal Management allows the Acquirer to configure and associate terminals (typically POS devices or QR interfaces) with each store. This setup is essential for enabling real-time transactions, QR scanning, and accurate transaction mapping per outlet.
terminalManagement.accessDesc: To manage terminals for a specific store:
accessSteps: Select View (: > View) on the desired store.
terminalManagement.addDesc1: After a store is approved, you can begin assigning terminals for transactions. A terminal represents a specific POS (Point of Sale) device or checkout point within the store.
terminalManagement.addDesc2: Click on Create New Terminal on the Terminal section.
terminalManagement.optionTitle: Option Selection – Single vs. Multiple Terminals
terminalManagement.optionDesc: Start by selecting whether you want to create a Single Terminal or Multiple Terminals.
optionList: Single Terminal: For stores with one checkout or payment point.
Multiple Terminals: For stores with several counters/devices (e.g., supermarkets or chains).
terminalManagement.optionNext: Click Next after making your selection.
singleList: Terminal ID: A unique identifier (e.g., T001).
Terminal Name: Assign a label (e.g., Terminal A).
Terminals: Shows current number of terminals in the store.
terminalManagement.singleNext: Click Yes to proceed and save the terminal.
multiList: Enter Number of Terminals you wish to create (e.g., 5).
terminalManagement.multiNext: Click Submit to auto-generate terminal IDs and assign them to the store.
statusList: They will appear in the Terminals Table.
Status will indicate whether each terminal is active or deactive.
You can manage each terminal individually via the Action button.
terminalManagement.statusNote: When activating or deactivating a terminal, a confirmation model will appear. You must click "OK" to proceed with the action.

merchantSuspend.title: Suspending Merchant
steps: Click on the three dots ”⋮” next to the merchant name.
A popup will prompt you to enter a reason before confirming the suspension.
merchantSuspend.note: Suspended merchants will be moved to the Suspended tab and can only be reactivated by contacting SriPay.

activatingSuspend.title: Activating Suspended Merchant
activatingSuspend.howToTitle: To activate a merchant after suspending:
steps: Click on the three dots ”⋮” and select Approve.
Upon approval, the merchant status will change from ‘suspended’ to ‘approved’.

agreementUpload.title: Uploading Merchant Agreements
agreementUpload.desc: Sub-Acquirers must upload merchant agreements before a merchant can proceed.
steps: Click Agreement from the merchant’s action menu
A model appears displaying already uploaded files and a button to Select PDF or Image
keyPoints: You can upload up to <1>5 agreement files</1>
Files must be in <1>PDF or image</1> format
Merchants can <1>view uploaded agreements</1> in their own portal
agreementUpload.note: This ensures transparency and legal compliance between SriPay, the Acquirer, and the merchant.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.desc: If you encounter issues during the merchant onboarding or bulk registration process, consider the following resolutions:

excel.solution: Ensure the file is in .xlsx format. .xls, .csv, or .ods are not accepted.

excel.issue: Column headers in sheet ‘Merchant’ were modified
excel.solution: Do not rename, remove, or reorder any column headers in the sample Excel.
Every row must contain data for all required fields—especially email, mobile, and registration details.

excel.issue: Excel file does not match the SriPay template
excel.solution: Download the latest sample Excel from the platform and follow the format exactly.

troubleshooting.docSolution: Ensure all document URLs are set to ‘Anyone with the link can view’ before submitting. This allows all reviewers (Sub-Acquirer → SriPay → Alipay) to access them.
kycReasons: Mismatched registration details and document names
troubleshooting.kycSolution: Double-check all entries and uploaded documents before submission.

questions.q: Q1: Can I edit a merchant’s KYC after submission?
questions.a: A: No. Once submitted, edits cannot be made. You must reject the submission and ask the merchant to re-register.

questions.q: Q2: What types of businesses are supported?
questions.a: A: SriPay supports Sole Proprietorships, Partnerships, Private and Public Limited Companies across a wide range of industries.

questions.q: Q3: Can I use my own Merchant ID?
questions.a: A: Yes. If your custom Merchant ID is available, the system will validate and accept it.

questions.q: Q4: What happens after I approve a merchant?
questions.a: A: The request is forwarded to SriPay for second-level review, then to Alipay for final evaluation. You will be notified at each stage.

questions.q: Q5: What if two merchants have the same email?
questions.a: A: Duplicate emails are not allowed. Each merchant must register with a unique email address.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.draftQ: What does the "Save as Draft" button do?
troubleshooting.draftA: It allows you to save your progress without submitting the form. You can return later to complete the submission.
troubleshooting.saveQ: Store details are not saving or submitting
troubleshooting.saveA: Check that all required fields are filled and formatted correctly. Look for any validation errors highlighted on the form. Try refreshing the page or clearing your browser cache if the problem persists.
troubleshooting.bankQ: Bank account information is being rejected
troubleshooting.bankA: Double-check that all bank details match the required format and are correct. Only one account can be set as default. If unsure, contact your bank or support.
troubleshooting.photoQ: Photo uploads are failing or not accepted
troubleshooting.photoA: Make sure your images are clear, in JPG or PNG format, and do not exceed the maximum file size. The store name board and interior should be clearly visible.
troubleshooting.pageQ: Page is not loading or is stuck
troubleshooting.pageA: Check your internet connection and try reloading the page. If the issue continues, try a different browser or device.

multiplestorecreation.title: Multiple Store Creation
multiplestorecreation.intro: This feature allows Merchants to create multiple stores simultaneously using a predefined Excel template.

sectionsMenu.section5: Upload and Validate the Excel File

alts.step4: Step 4: Download & Fill the Sample Excel
alts.step5: Step 5: Upload and Validate the Excel File

steps1.title: Step 1: Navigate to Stores Tab
steps1.li1: Go to the Stores section from the Top Navigation Bar.

steps2.title: Step 2: Select Multiple Store Option
steps2.p1: You'll see 2 options for store creation.
steps2.single: Single Store – This option is to create a single store.
steps2.multiple: Multiple Stores – This option is to create multiple stores at once.
steps2.p2: From there pick the Multiple Store option and click Next button.

steps3.title: Step 3: Understand the Upload Modal
steps3.li1: Excel File Upload Area – drag/drop or browse to upload.
steps3.li2: Download Sample Excel – click this to get the correct format.
steps3.li3: Important Note – file must be .xlsx, and all images/documents must be pre-uploaded.

steps4.title: Step 4: Download & Fill the Sample Excel
steps4.ol1: Click "Download Sample Excel" to get the correct format.
steps4.rulesTitle: Important Rules to follow when filling the excel file:
steps4.r3: Every row must contain valid entries for all columns.
steps4.r4: Email must be unique and properly formatted.
steps4.r5: Mobile number must follow a valid format (+94).
steps4.r6: Ensure that all uploaded document URLs are publicly accessible to anyone with the link.
steps4.r7: Because evaluation involves Sub‑Acquirer, SriPay, and Alipay, document URLs must be publicly accessible to ensure seamless review across all stages.

steps5.title: Step 5: Upload and Validate the Excel File
steps5.li1: Click the upload box or drag your completed .xlsx file into it.

table.row2c3: Column headers in sheet "Merchant" were modified...
table.row3c2: No blank Store Name, Email, etc.
table.row3c3: Row 2: missing value for Store Name

steps5.onFail1: A red error modal will appear showing the exact issue.
steps5.onFail2: Click "OK", fix the Excel file, and re-upload.

steps6.title: Step 6: Upload Progress
steps6.li1: You will see the message: "Uploading Stores..." or something similar.
steps6.li2: Wait until the process completes and the modal closes.

evaluation.title: Store Evaluation Procedure
evaluation.acquirerPara: Once a store is submitted, it enters the Pending Requests stage for review and evaluation by the acquirer. The approval process ensures store legitimacy and compliance before activation.
evaluation.sripayPara: If the Sub-Acquirer sends the application forward, it moves to the SriPay Admin Panel for a second-level review.
evaluation.sripayReject: Reject with comments and notify Sub-Acquirer
evaluation.sysNotify: Sub-Acquirer is notified of SriPay's decision
evaluation.sysProgress: Merchant store remains in "SriPay In Progress" until final decision
evaluation.alipayPara: If SriPay approves the application, it is submitted to Alipay+ Team. This includes an automatic or manual compliance check by Alipay.
evaluation.alipayApprove: Approve: Merchant store is now live for payment acceptance
evaluation.alipayReject: Reject: Sent back with reason; Sub-Acquirer and SriPay are notified

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.q1: My Excel file upload fails or is rejected.
troubleshooting.a1: Ensure you are using the latest template provided by the system. Double-check that all required columns are present and that there are no empty mandatory fields. Remove any custom extra formatting or merged cells.
troubleshooting.q2: I get a "format error" or "invalid data" message.
troubleshooting.a2: Make sure all fields follow the required format (e.g., phone numbers, emails, IDs). Refer to the rules and examples shown above for each column.
troubleshooting.q3: The page is not loading or is stuck.
troubleshooting.a3: Check your internet connection and try reloading the page. If the issue continues, try using a different browser or device.

storeusersassign.title: Assigning Store Users
storeusersassign.intro: To assign a store user, the merchant must complete the 'Add Store User' form by providing the user's Full Name, Email Address, and Password. An OTP (One-Time Password) will be sent to the entered email address for verification. The user must verify the email before activating their account.
storeusersassign.step1: Step 1: Go to My Account and select Store Users. Then click the Add Store User button.
storeusersassign.step2: Step 2: Click the Add Store User button to open the form.
storeusersassign.manage: To update a store user's information or change their status, click the action menu (three dots) in the row. From there, select Edit to modify user details or Deactivate to revoke access.

terminalmanagement.title: Terminal Management
terminalmanagement.intro: Terminal Management allows the Merchant to configure and associate terminals with each store.

sectionsMenu.section3: Option Selection – Single vs. Multiple Terminals

section1.title: Accessing Terminal Management
section1.lead: To manage terminals for a specific store

ol.li2: Select the store you want to manage terminals for by clicking on the store.
ol.li3: View the list of existing terminals or create new ones.

section1.important: Terminal management for a store is permitted only once that store’s status has been set to Approved.

section2.title: Adding a Terminal
section2.p1: After a store is approved, you can begin assigning terminals for transactions. A terminal represents a specific POS (Point of Sale) device or checkout point within the store.
section2.placesTitle: Terminals can be added from 2 places.
section2.fromMenu: From the three-dots menu … next to Commission Rate

section3.title: Option Selection – Single vs. Multiple Terminals
section3.p1: Start by selecting whether you want to create a Single Terminal or Multiple Terminals.

bullets.single: Single Terminal: For stores with just one checkout point or counter.
bullets.multiple: Multiple Terminals: For stores with several counters/devices (e.g., supermarkets or chains).

section3.p2: Click Next after making your selection to proceed with the creation process.

section4.title: Creating a Single Terminal
section4.b1: The terminal name will be automatically generated (e.g., Terminal 1).
section4.b2: You cannot change the terminal name as it's system-generated for consistency.
section4.b3: All created terminals are set to "Active" status by default.
section4.p: Click Create to finalize your single terminal setup.

section5.title: Creating Multiple Terminals
section5.b1: Enter the number of terminals you wish to create (e.g., 5) and click Create to generate multiple terminals at once.
section5.p: This will create the specified number of terminals with sequential naming (Terminal 1, Terminal 2, etc.).

section6.title: Activate or Deactivate Terminal
section6.b1: To change a terminal's status, locate it in the terminal list.
section6.b2: Click the toggle switch in the "Active" column to activate or deactivate it.
section6.b3: Inactive terminals will not be available for payment processing until reactivated.
section6.noteDesc: Status changes take effect immediately, but may require up to 5 minutes to propagate across all systems.

section7.title: Troubleshooting
section7.q1: I can't add a terminal or the "Add Terminal" button is disabled.
section7.a1: Ensure you have the correct permissions and have selected a merchant/store. If the merchant or store is not approved, you may not be able to add terminals.
section7.q2: I can't change the terminal name.
section7.a2: You cannot change the default terminal name. Terminal names are auto-generated based on the terminal count.
section7.q3: The page is not loading or is stuck.
section7.a3: Check your internet connection and try reloading the page. If the issue continues, try using a different browser or device.

instore.title: In-store payments
instore.heroLead: Enable seamless in-store payments from global customers with one simple integration. Discover how advanced digital payment solutions and QR code technology can streamline transactions, reduce costs, and enhance the customer experience at your physical store.

bullets.purpose: Select or type the Purpose of Payment

instore.infoBanner: Want to know more about each payment method? Click on any payment option below to learn how it works.

alipayPlus.cardDesc: Customers scan the merchant-generated QR code with the order information to pay.
alipayPlus.enterHint: The merchant can choose the preferred currency type — either LKR or USD — before entering the amount.
alipayPlus.scanTextPre: Scan the QR code below using your device with the
alipayPlus.completeText: After completing the payment, the merchant will see a "Payment Received" success message.

scanPay.cardTitle: Scan Pay QR Via Alipay Plus
scanPay.cardDesc: Merchants scan the user-presented QR code to collect payment.
scanPay.detailsTitle: Scan Pay QR Via Alipay Plus
scanPay.enterHint: The merchant can choose the preferred currency type — either LKR or USD — before entering the amount.
scanPay.scanText: After creating the transaction, Alipay Plus generates a QR code. Use your device’s camera (as shown below) to scan and confirm the code securely.
scanPay.completeText: Once the payment is complete, the merchant will see a success message indicating "Payment Received".

sripay.cardDesc: Enable seamless in-store payments from global customers with one simple integration.
sripay.soonText: This payment method is coming soon!

visamaster.cardDesc: Accept payments from global customers via credit or debit cards.
visamaster.p1: Feature coming soon! Accept worldwide Visa/MasterCard payments securely at your counter.
visamaster.p2: You’ll be able to accept both chip and contactless card payments.

usdt.cardDesc: Let your customers pay securely using Tether (USDT) cryptocurrency.
usdt.p1: Coming soon: Accept payments in USDT, one of the world’s leading cryptocurrencies.
usdt.p2: Seamless conversion to LKR with low transaction fees.

online.title: Online Payments
online.heroLead:
A single integration into Antom allows you to accept all onboarded e-wallets, cards, and alternative payment methods. When new payment channels are onboarded in the future, you can also start accepting them with minimal effort.

Learn how the different online payment types can facilitate your payment collection using the resources below.

howTo.title: How to create an Online Transaction?

online.note: Note: If you are targeting a specific wallet for the transaction, you can click on the 'Target Wallet' tab to view all related information. If you are targeting all wallets, you can access the relevant details by clicking on the 'Target All Wallets' tab.

targetWallet.lead: When merchants target a wallet, they can proceed by choosing how the customer will complete the payment: either via Web or Mobile.

web.title: Web Payment Flow
web.desc: In this process, the merchant starts an Alipay+ transaction by choosing Web. A payment link is generated and can be shared directly with the customer, who completes payment in the browser.
web.selectDesc: Choose the preferred payment method for the transaction. Options include Alipay+ and SriPay.
web.receiptDesc: Generate a QR code for customers to scan, or copy/share the payment link directly for flexible completion.

mobile.title: Mobile Payment Flow
mobile.desc: Select Mobile as the user pay type to define the customer’s device environment. Then specify iOS/Android and In-App or In-Browser for a seamless experience.
mobile.selectDesc: Choose the preferred method (Alipay+ or SriPay) to determine processing flow and experience.
mobile.receiptDesc: Complete the transaction with the payment link and share it with the customer.

targetAll.lead: When merchants target all wallets, they can still proceed using either Web or Mobile based on the option chosen below.

web.title: Web Payment Flow
web.desc: With Web as the user pay type, the customer completes payment directly in the browser—ideal for desktop or app-free checkout.
web.selectDesc: Choose the preferred method (Alipay+ or SriPay) to determine processing flow and experience.
web.receiptDesc: Complete the transaction using the payment link and share it with the customer.

mobile.title: Mobile Payment Flow
mobile.desc: Select Mobile as the user pay type and then specify iOS/Android and In-App or In-Browser for a seamless experience.
mobile.selectDesc: Choose the preferred method (Alipay+ or SriPay) to determine processing flow and experience.
mobile.receiptDesc: Generate a QR for scan-to-pay, or copy/share the payment link for flexible completion.

cardpayments.title: Card Payments
cardpayments.intro: SriPay offers seamless card payment acceptance through Visa, Mastercard, and UnionPay. Merchants can process both domestic and international transactions with ease, enabling fast, secure, and reliable card-based payments. Whether it's online or in-store, SriPay ensures a frictionless experience for your customers while maintaining the highest security standards.

paymentLink.title: Payment Link Creation
paymentLink.p1: This screen confirms that a merchant has successfully created a card payment link for a customer. The pop-up message “Payment Link Created Successfully!” indicates that the transaction has been initialized. The merchant can see key details such as:

list.clientRef: Client Reference – Unique transaction identifier for internal tracking.
list.requestId: Request ID – Unique request token for the payment API call.
list.expiresAt: Expires At – The date and time after which the payment link will no longer be valid.
list.paymentUrl: Payment Page URL – A secure link to the customer-facing payment page, which can be opened directly or copied for sharing.

paymentLink.p2: Below, there’s an “Open Payment Page” button for instant access, and the “Next Steps” note explains that the customer must complete payment before the expiry time.

instorereports.title: Alipay+ In-Store Reports
instorereports.intro: The Alipay+ In-Store Reports page provides merchants with a clear and comprehensive overview of all settled in-store transactions. It allows you to instantly generate detailed reports, track transaction performance, and monitor settlement history.

alts.kpi: Settled transactions overview with KPIs for success, refunded, voided and totals

settled.title: Settled Transactions
settled.desc: The Settled Transactions section provides merchants with a quick snapshot of all finalized in-store payment activities. It helps monitor transaction outcomes and assess overall business performance at a glance.

kpis.success: Success Transactions: Total number of payments that were completed successfully and settled.
kpis.refunded: Refunded Transactions: Total number of transactions where the payment amount was returned to the customer.
kpis.voided: Voided Transactions: Total number of payments that were canceled before settlement.
kpis.total: Total Value: Combined value of all settled transactions, displayed in both USD and LKR for clarity.

items.date: Date and time when the transaction occurred.
items.id: Unique identifier assigned to each transaction.
items.store: Name of the merchant store where the transaction was made.
items.currency: The currency in which the transaction was processed.
items.actions: Options for further actions, such as viewing more details.

onlinereports.title: Alipay+ Online Reports
onlinereports.intro: The Alipay+ Online Reports page provides merchants with a clear and comprehensive overview of all settled online transactions. It allows you to instantly generate detailed reports, track transaction performance, and monitor settlement history.

alts.kpi: Settled transactions overview with KPIs for success, refunded, voided and totals

settled.title: Settled Transactions
settled.desc: The Settled Transactions section provides merchants with a quick snapshot of all finalized online payment activities. It helps monitor transaction outcomes and assess overall business performance at a glance.

kpis.success: Success Transactions: Total number of payments that were completed successfully and settled.
kpis.refunded: Refunded Transactions: Total number of transactions where the payment amount was returned to the customer.
kpis.voided: Voided Transactions: Total number of payments that were canceled before settlement.
kpis.total: Total Value: Combined value of all settled transactions, displayed in both USD and LKR for clarity.

items.date: Date and time when the transaction occurred.
items.id: Unique identifier assigned to each transaction.
items.store: Name of the merchant store where the transaction was made.
items.currency: The currency in which the transaction was processed.
items.actions: Options for further actions, such as viewing more details.

cardreports.title: Card Payments Report
cardreports.intro: SriPay enables merchants to accept secure and reliable card payments through Visa, Mastercard, and UnionPay, supporting both domestic and international transactions. The Card Payments Report provides a clear overview of all settled transactions, allowing merchants to generate detailed reports, track sales performance, and monitor settlement history. Whether payments are made online or in-store, SriPay ensures a fast, frictionless experience for customers while maintaining the highest security standards.

alts.kpi: Settled transactions overview with KPIs for totals and values

settled.title: Settled Transactions
settled.desc: This summary shows the finalized card payments that have been settled to your account for the selected date range and filters. It helps you quickly understand volume and value without opening the full table.

kpis.totalTx: Total Transactions: Count of card payments that reached final settlement within the selected period. Pending, declined, or voided payments are not included.
kpis.success: Success Transactions: Number of settled payments with a final status of Success (authorized, captured, and settled).
kpis.totalUsd: Total Value in USD: Sum of settled card payments shown in USD. For multi-currency settlements, amounts are displayed in USD according to the settlement currency configuration.
kpis.totalLkr: Total Value in LKR: Sum of the same settled card payments shown in LKR for local reporting.

notes.n1: The metrics respect your current filters (date range, store, payment method, etc.).
notes.n2: Values show the settled amount (captured & settled), not the originally authorized amount.
notes.n3: Pending, declined, or voided payments are excluded from these totals.
notes.n4: Amounts are displayed in both USD and LKR and rounded to two decimals.

items.date: Date and time when the transaction occurred.
items.id: Unique identifier assigned to each transaction.
items.store: Name of the merchant store where the transaction was made.
items.currency: The currency in which the transaction was processed.
items.actions: Options for further actions, such as viewing more details.

troubleshootings.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshootings.intro: This guide provides solutions to common issues faced by Merchants and Store Users in SriPay.

items.issue: OTP not received during store user assignment
items.solution: Ask the user to check their spam/junk folder. Make sure a valid email address was entered.
Ensure all fields (Full Name, Email, Password) are filled and the email is unique.

items.issue: Merchant registration stuck on "Waiting for Approval"
items.solution: This is normal. Wait until the Acquirer approves the request. No user action is required.
Ensure the uploaded media file is at least 10MB in size. Files smaller than 10MB may not be accepted.
Resend the OTP from the merchant dashboard. Ensure the user enters the correct OTP within the time limit.
Make sure the account is verified and active. Try resetting the password if necessary.

supports.title: Support Information
supports.banner: If you need assistance, please contact the SriPay Merchant Support Team:

email.title: Email
email.blurb: Contact the specific business or technical support team relevant to your needs, and we will get back to you within 1 business day:

website.title: Website
website.blurb: Visit our official website for more details, documentation, and the latest updates about our services.

mobile.title: Mobile
mobile.blurb: Reach out directly via phone for immediate assistance with merchant handling or technical support.

q1.q: Can I edit a merchant’s KYC after submission?
q1.a: No. Once submitted, edits cannot be made. You must reject the submission and ask the merchant to re-register.

q2.q: What types of businesses are supported?
q2.a: SriPay supports Sole Proprietorships, Partnerships, Private and Public Limited Companies across a wide range of industries.

q3.q: Can I use my own Merchant ID?
q3.a: Yes. If your custom Merchant ID is available, the system will validate and accept it.

q4.q: What happens after I approve a merchant?
q4.a: The request is forwarded to SriPay for second-level review, then to Alipay for final evaluation. You will be notified at each stage.

q5.q: What if two merchants have the same email?
q5.a: Duplicate emails are not allowed. Each merchant must register with a unique email address.

devgettingstart.title: What is SriPay Developer Documentation?
devgettingstart.p1: SriPay Developer Documentation is a comprehensive guide designed to help developers integrate and utilize SriPay's payment solutions effectively. It provides detailed information on API endpoints, authentication methods, and best practices for building applications with SriPay.
devgettingstart.p2: SriPay Connect is built on a modern tech stack including React.js with Tailwind CSS and Ant Design for the frontend, Express.js with clustering for the backend, and Google Cloud Platform infrastructure. The system utilizes Firestore for structured data storage and Realtime Database for live transaction updates, ensuring optimal performance and scalability.
devgettingstart.p3: Our platform provides comprehensive merchant management, store management, transaction processing, settlement handling, and detailed reporting capabilities. Security is paramount with JWT/OAuth 2.0 authentication, AES-256-CBC encryption, RSA2-signed communications with Alipay+, and full PCI DSS compliance through tokenization.
devgettingstart.p4: The documentation covers system architecture, mobile Flutter applications with Firebase Cloud Messaging, RESTful API endpoints, third-party integrations including SMS gateways and Google Analytics, deployment on GCP Cloud Run, and comprehensive maintenance and support procedures with a 99.9% uptime SLA and tiered L1–L3 support.
devgettingstart.p5_prefix: Access detailed technical specifications, integration guides, and developer resources at
devgettingstart.p5_suffix: to get started with SriPay Connect integration.

systemintro.title: Introduction
systemintro.p1: SriPay Connect is a cloud-based payment Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) application designed to facilitate seamless international and local digital payments through Alipay+ (online and offline) for merchants, bridging global customers with businesses in Sri Lanka and beyond. This System Architecture Report is prepared for banking partners to provide a comprehensive overview of SriPay Connect technical architecture, security measures, integration capabilities, and operational resilience to support secure and scalable payment processing.
systemintro.p2: SriPay Connect serves a diverse audience, including merchants, financial institutions, and payment service providers, offering robust features such as merchant management, store management, transaction management, settlement, and detailed transaction reporting. Built with modern technologies and hosted on a secure cloud infrastructure, the application ensures high availability, compliance, and customization to meet branding requirements.
systemintro.p3: This document outlines the systems architecture, detailing frontend and backend components, database design, security protocols, API integrations, compliance, and ensuring transparency and confidence for banking partners seeking integration.

systemarch.title: System Architecture Overview
systemarch.p1: SriPay Connect is engineered as a cloud-native, modular platform that combines a microservices-driven backend, a responsive web/mobile frontend, and hardened database infrastructure. It natively integrates Alipay+ for both online and offline payments, while plug-in connectors handle notifications, analytics, and other third-party services. Open, RESTful APIs ensure effortless extensibility across partners.
systemarch.p2: Security and observability are woven throughout the stack: JWT/OAuth 2.0 for auth, AES-256-CBC secrets managed via GCP KMS, RSA2-signed calls to Alipay+, plus centralised logging and distributed tracing for end-to-end visibility and rapid incident response.

items.webApp: Web Application: Built with React.js, Tailwind CSS, and Ant Design (AntD) for a responsive, customizable user interface supporting merchant and store management, transaction reporting, settlement and different user roles.
items.mobileApp: Mobile Application: Built with Flutter (Dart) using Material 3, integrates Firebase Cloud Messaging for push alerts, and delivers merchant & store management, transaction reporting, settlement, and role-based access all in one cross-platform app.
items.backend: Back-End Server: Powered by Express.js with clustering for scalability, handling business logic, API orchestration, and integrations.
items.database: Database: Firestore for structured data and Realtime Database for realtime transaction updates, with daily JSON backups for recovery.
items.notification: Notification Server: Node.js Express server hosted on GCP, handling SMS and email notifications.
items.openSeaApi: Open Sea API Server: Built on Express.js with clustering for high performance and scalability, responsible for executing core business logic, orchestrating APIs, and managing integrations with external services.
items.security: Security Layer: JWT and OAuth for secure authentication, along with AES encryption and tokenization to protect sensitive data, ensuring confidentiality, integrity, and compliance with industry security standards.
items.backupDb: Backup DB: A separate Firestore database dedicated to storing JSON backups, ensuring data redundancy, disaster recovery readiness, and long-term archival of critical information.

webarch.title: Web Application Architecture
webarch.p1: The frontend of SriPay Connect is a web application developed using React.js, styled with Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling, and enhanced with Ant Design (AntD) for consistent, enterprise-grade UI components. The architecture emphasizes modularity, performance, and customization to support branding requirements.

framework.label: Framework
framework.desc: React.js for component-based development, enabling reusable UI elements.

styling.label: Styling
styling.desc: Tailwind CSS for rapid, responsive design. AntD for pre-built components like tables, forms, and modals.

state.label: State Management
state.desc: React Context API and Redux for managing application state, ensuring seamless updates for transaction and merchant data.

routing.label: Routing
routing.desc: React Router for navigation across modules (e.g., Merchant Management, Transaction Reports).

customization.label: Customization
customization.desc: Supports white-labeling, allowing merchants to customize UI elements (logos, colors, themes) while retaining “Powered by SriPay” branding.

performance.label: Performance
performance.desc: Lazy loading, code splitting, and optimized asset delivery via Webpack.

accessibility.label: Accessibility
accessibility.desc: Adheres to WCAG 2.1 standards for inclusive access.

mobilearch.title: Mobile Application Architecture
mobilearch.p1: The mobile application for SriPay Connect is developed using Flutter to deliver a cross-platform, high-performance experience on both iOS and Android. It leverages Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) for real-time push notifications, and integrates with SriPay’s backend APIs for seamless data synchronization. The architecture focuses on modularity, responsiveness, and security to ensure a consistent user experience across devices.

framework.label: Framework
framework.desc: Flutter for cross-platform development, enabling a single codebase for iOS and Android while maintaining native-like performance.

styling.label: Styling
styling.desc: Flutter’s widget-based UI system for customizable, responsive layouts; supports theming for branding consistency.

state.label: State Management
state.desc: Provider and Riverpod/Bloc for structured state handling, ensuring smooth data flow and real-time UI updates.

routing.label: Routing
routing.desc: Flutter’s Navigator 2.0 for structured, declarative navigation across features.

notifications.label: Notifications
notifications.desc: Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) for real-time push notifications on transactions, settlements, and account updates.

performance.label: Performance
performance.desc: Optimized rendering, minimal widget rebuilds, and asset preloading for a smooth user experience.

security.label: Security
security.desc: Secure storage for sensitive data, HTTPS for API communication, and token-based authentication (JWT/OAuth).

backendarch.title: Backend Architecture
backendarch.p1: The backend is built with Express.js, a lightweight Node.js framework, configured with clustering to utilize multi-core systems for high throughput. It follows a microservices-inspired design, with modular services for transaction processing, merchant management, and third-party integrations.

framework.label: Framework
framework.desc: Express.js for RESTful API development, with middleware for logging, error handling, and rate limiting.

clustering.label: Clustering
clustering.desc: Node.js Cluster module to distribute workloads across CPU cores, ensuring scalability and improved performance.

api.label: API Design
api.desc: RESTful endpoints with JSON payloads, documented via OpenAPI/Swagger for clarity and developer adoption.

integration.label: Integration Layer
integration.desc: Dedicated service modules for Alipay+ online/offline payment processing and Google Analytics tracking.

error.label: Error Handling
error.desc: Centralized error management with custom error codes, structured responses, and integrated logging for monitoring and troubleshooting.

scalability.label: Scalability
scalability.desc: Supports horizontal scaling via containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).

monitoring.label: Monitoring
monitoring.desc: Integrated with logging frameworks (GCP Log) and performance monitoring tools for proactive system health tracking.

databasearch.title: Database Architecture
databasearch.p1: SriPay Connect uses Google Cloud Firestore for structured data storage, Realtime Database for live transaction updates, and daily JSON backups for data redundancy.

schema.label: Schema
schema.desc: Hierarchical structure with documents for merchant profiles, store details, transaction records, and settlement logs.

indexing.label: Indexing
indexing.desc: Composite indexes for frequent queries (e.g., transaction status, date ranges). Stores transient data for real-time transaction updates, synchronized with Firestore. Supports live dashboards and instant notifications.

backup.label: JSON Backup
backup.desc: Daily exports from Firestore to another Firestore database for archival and disaster recovery. Backup schema mirrors primary Firestore collections with normalized structures.

integrity.label: Data Integrity
integrity.desc: Firestore triggers and validation rules enforce consistency and prevent invalid data entry.

performance.label: Performance
performance.desc: Optimized queries, composite indexing, and caching strategies ensure fast reads in high-traffic scenarios.

auth.title: Authentication and Authorization
auth.p1: SriPay Connect implements strong authentication and authorization measures to ensure secure access and protect sensitive user data. All requests to backend APIs are token-based and validated before processing.

jwt.label: JWT (JSON Web Tokens)
jwt.desc: Stateless session management with tokens signed using RSA256 for strong cryptographic security.

oauth.label: OAuth 2.0
oauth.desc: Supports third-party authentication (e.g., Google, Alipay) for merchants and admins.

tokenization.label: Tokenization
tokenization.desc: Sensitive exchanges use tokenized payloads to avoid direct exposure of confidential data.

points.access: Access tokens have a maximum lifetime of 1 hour.
points.refresh: Refresh tokens provide longer validity and are stored securely to renew sessions without re-authentication.

aes.label: AES-256 Encryption
aes.desc: Stored and transmitted sensitive data is encrypted with AES-256-CBC.

rbac.label: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
rbac.desc: Roles include Admin, Merchant, Store Manager, and Viewer.

policy.label: Policy Enforcement
policy.desc: Express.js middleware checks JWT claims to validate role permissions before granting access to protected routes.

items.short: Short-lived access tokens (1 hour max) with refresh tokens for continuity.
items.storage: Secure HTTPS-only cookies or encrypted local storage for token storage.
items.invalidate: Automatic token invalidation on logout, password change, or account deactivation.

items.requireJwt: All API endpoints require valid JWT authentication.
items.httpsOnly: Tokens are transmitted only over HTTPS.
items.monitoring: Middleware logs and monitors failed authentication attempts for anomaly detection.
items.rateLimit: Rate limiting and IP throttling mitigate brute-force or token-abuse attempts.

encsec.title: Encryption and Security
encsec.p1: SriPay Connect prioritizes data security by implementing industry-standard encryption, secure communication protocols, and multi-layered protection mechanisms.

items.https: All communications use HTTPS with TLS 1.3 for maximum security and forward secrecy.
items.rsa: RSA256 for digital signatures and asymmetric encryption.
items.hash: SHA-256 and MD5 (where legacy compatibility is required) for hashing and integrity checks.

items.aes: AES-256-CBC encryption for sensitive fields stored in Firestore databases.
items.gcp: Google Cloud’s default encryption for Firestore and Realtime Database.

items.scope: Sensitive payment data is tokenized using Alipay+ APIs, minimizing PCI DSS compliance scope.
items.store: Tokenized values are stored instead of raw payment data, reducing risk in the event of a breach.

items.pentest: Regular penetration testing and vulnerability scanning to detect and fix weaknesses.
items.logging: Centralized logging and monitoring for detecting suspicious activity.

items.waf: Web Application Firewall (WAF) to block DDoS attacks, SQL injection, and cross-site scripting (XSS).
items.allow: IP allowlisting and geofencing for sensitive admin endpoints.
items.ratelimit: Rate limiting to prevent abuse of public APIs.

apisec.title: API Security
apisec.p1: SriPay Connect’s RESTful APIs are protected with multi-layered security measures to prevent unauthorized access, safeguard sensitive data, and maintain system integrity.

items.require: All API endpoints require JWT and Access Key tokens for access.
items.claims: Token claims are validated via Express.js middleware before processing requests.

items.limit: Rate limiting implemented with Express.js middleware to control request frequency and mitigate abuse.
items.throttle: IP throttling for repeated failed authentication attempts.

items.strict: Strict Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) rules to allow access only from trusted domains.
items.preflight: Preflight checks enforce origin, method, and header restrictions.

items.validate: All incoming data is validated and sanitized using libraries like Joi to prevent injection attacks.
items.protect: Protection against SQL injection, XSS, and malformed JSON payloads.

items.gcp: Google Cloud API Gateway for additional security, traffic routing, and monitoring.
items.monitor: Integration with Google Cloud Monitoring & Logging for real-time tracking of API activity.

items.audit: All API requests logged for auditing and debugging, with sensitive data excluded from logs.
items.retain: Logs retained per compliance requirements for forensic analysis.

deployinfra.title: Deployment & Infrastructure
deployinfra.p1: SriPay Connect is deployed on a multi-cloud architecture primarily leveraging Google Cloud Platform (GCP) with a separate server for notifications, ensuring high availability, scalability, and redundancy.

items.cloudrun: GCP Cloud Run for containerized Express.js backend services, enabling serverless scaling and efficient resource utilization.
items.hosting: GCP Firebase Hosting for serving static React.js frontend assets with global CDN delivery.
items.firestore: Firestore and Realtime Database hosted in us-central1 for low-latency access.

items.separate: Separate server for high-throughput SMS and email notifications.
items.integrated: Integrated with backend services for transactional and alert messages.

items.compute: GCP Compute Engine instances for scheduled SQL backups and recovery operations.
items.daily: Daily Firestore and Realtime Database backups to secondary GCP regions for redundancy.

items.autoscale: Auto-scaling policies for Cloud Run triggered by CPU and memory utilization thresholds.
items.coldstart: Optimized cold start performance for backend services.

items.gcpmon: Google Cloud Monitoring for real-time performance tracking and uptime checks.
items.alerts: Automated alerts for anomalies, latency spikes, or failed deployments.

thirdparty.title: Third-Party Integrations
thirdparty.p1: SriPay Connect leverages trusted third-party services to extend its capabilities and deliver a seamless payment and management experience.

items.support: Supports online and offline payment methods, including QR code scanning and mobile wallet transactions.
items.integrated: Fully integrated via Alipay+ SDKs and APIs for secure transaction processing, settlement, and reconciliation.

items.powers: Powers transaction alerts, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and critical merchant communications.
items.templates: Supports configurable notification templates for branding and personalized messaging.

items.tracks: Tracks user interactions, transaction funnels, and merchant engagement metrics.
items.gtm: Integrated via Google Tag Manager for advanced frontend analytics and event tracking.

compliance.title: Compliance and Privacy
compliance.p1: SriPay Connect adheres to global and local regulations to ensure compliance, protect user privacy, and maintain trust with merchants and customers.

items.pci: PCI DSS: Fully compliant with Level 1 payment processing requirements, leveraging Alipay+ tokenization to minimize PCI scope.
items.gdpr: GDPR: Complies with the EU General Data Protection Regulation, including data minimization, explicit user consent, and right-to-erasure practices.
items.local: Local Regulations: Meets Sri Lankan financial regulations and Central Bank of Sri Lanka guidelines for payment service providers.
items.privacy: Privacy Policy: Transparent policies outlining data collection, usage, retention, and sharing practices.
items.terms: Terms & Conditions: Clearly defines service usage rules, merchant obligations, and dispute resolution procedures.
items.audits: Audits: Regular third-party compliance audits to verify adherence to regulatory and security standards.

maintenance.title: Maintenance and Support
maintenance.p1: SriPay Connect provides comprehensive maintenance and support services to ensure system stability, optimal performance, and uninterrupted payment operations.

items.updates: Updates: Continuous delivery of security patches, bug fixes, and feature enhancements via the CI/CD pipeline.
items.monitoring: Monitoring: 24/7 real-time monitoring with automated alerts for performance anomalies, security events, and service degradation.
items.support: Support: Tiered support model (L1–L3) available via email and phone for issue tracking and resolution.
items.sla: Service Level Agreement (SLA): 99.9% uptime guarantee with 2-hour response times for critical priority issues.
items.docs: Documentation: Comprehensive user guides, API documentation, and administrative manuals for merchants, admins, and developers.

acqApi.title: Acquirer API Overview
acqApi.p1: The Acquirer API, powered by SriPay and integrated with Alipay+, provides a secure and robust solution for merchants to process payments, manage accounts, and handle transactions programmatically. This API supports various payment methods, including online payments, merchant-presented mode payments (dynamic QR codes), user-presented mode payments, payment voids, and refunds. Designed for simplicity and security, the API ensures consistent request handling through common headers and strict validation.
acqApi.p2: This documentation outlines the API's endpoints, request structures, workflows, and error scenarios, with examples to facilitate integration.

url.intro: The SriPay Connect ACQ API follows a structured request URL format, which is composed of two distinct parts
url.bulletHost: Host – The base URL of the SriPay Connect ACQ API environment you are connecting to.
url.bulletEndpoint: Endpoint – The specific API path that defines the service or operation being requested.

method.intro: SriPay Connect ACQ APIs support only two HTTPS request methods
method.postDesc: Used for creating or submitting new data to the server.
method.postExample: Example: Initiating a payment, creating a transaction, sending a request for processing.
method.getDesc: Used for retrieving data from the server.
method.getExample: Example: Fetching transaction details, retrieving status updates, or querying records.

headers.intro: All SriPay Connect ACQ API requests must include the following headers to ensure proper authentication and routing:

table.authorizationDesc: API key used for authenticating requests.
table.authKeyDesc: Additional authentication key for enhanced security validation.
table.acquirerIdDesc: Unique identifier assigned to each acquirer for request routing and access control.
table.contentTypeDesc: Defines the format of the request body. Always use application/json.

respBody.intro: All API responses include a Result object containing three key fields
respBody.code: Code – A short, machine readable identifier that indicates the outcome of the request. This is used primarily for programmatic handling.
respBody.message: Message – A human readable description providing additional details about the result. This is suitable for user-facing error messages and logging.
respBody.status: Status – The business level outcome category of the request or transaction. This helps track workflow states such as approval, rejection, or pending processing.

respCodes.intro: SriPay Connect ACQ APIs return standard HTTP status codes along with the response body to indicate the result of the request at the protocol level.

table.200_desc: The request was successful and the server returned the expected data.
table.201_desc: The request was successful and a new resource was created.
table.202_desc: The request has been accepted for processing, but the operation is not yet complete.
table.204_desc: The request was successful but there is no content to return.
table.400_desc: The request was malformed or missing required parameters.
table.401_desc: Authentication failed or API key is missing/invalid.
table.403_desc: The authenticated user does not have permission to perform this action.
table.404_desc: The requested resource could not be found.
table.409_desc: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

acqEndpoints.title: Endpoints
acqEndpoints.intro: SriPay Connect provides the following API endpoints, enabling acquirers to seamlessly integrate with their Web, POS systems or other payment platforms.

instore.title: Alipay+ In-store API
instore.desc: Facilitates secure, real-time payment initiation, processing, and status tracking for in-store transactions using Alipay+ QR technology. These APIs enable merchants to accept payments by scanning customer-presented codes or generating merchant-issued QR codes, while providing reliable mechanisms to query and monitor transaction outcomes.

online.title: Alipay+ Online API
online.desc: Alipay+ Online API is a lightweight REST interface that plugs your website or any internet-facing app straight into the global Alipay+ wallet network. With a single endpoint you spin up a secure, branded payment link, redirect the buyer to Alipay+ checkout, and then get real-time callbacks for payment status, refunds, and settlement data with no additional gateway layers or region-specific code needed.

orderCodePayQr.lede1: The Order Code Pay option allows the merchant to generate a dynamic QR code and display it to the customer for payment. The merchant then receives the payment result in real time. The following API specifies the criteria required to initiate the request.
orderCodePayQr.lede2: This endpoint generates a QR code for Alipay+ offline transactions by creating an order with the provided acquirer, outlet, and terminal details, tailored for acquirer-specific integrations.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.desc: Initiates an Alipay+ offline transaction by generating a QR code for payment, validated against acquirer credentials.

headers.title: Headers
headers.acqId: acquirerid or x-acq-id (string, required): The unique identifier of the acquirer.
headers.authorization: Authorization (string, required): The authorization key for the acquirer.
headers.authKey: Auth-Key (string, required): The authentication key for the acquirer.

requestBody.title: Request Body
requestBody.intro: The request body must be in JSON format and include the following parameters

amount.validation: Must be a positive number greater than 0.

subject.validation: Must be a string, max length 100 characters.

currency.validation: Must be either USD or LKR.

validationBullets.amount: amount: Required, must be a positive number (greater than 0).
validationBullets.subject: subject: Required, string with a maximum length of 100 characters.
validationBullets.currency: currency: Required, must be one of USD or LKR.

orderCodeResultListener.intro: This endpoint establishes a real-time connection using Server-Sent Events (SSE) to listen for updates on Alipay+ transactions identified by outTradeNo. It streams transaction status changes, converting timestamps from GMT+8 to Asia/Colombo (GMT+5:30).

acqUpwWait_intro: This endpoint retrieves the status of a user-presented Alipay transaction awaiting authentication, identified by partnerTransId. It allows rechecking to verify if user authentication has occurred, returning the latest transaction details.
acqUpwWait_endpoint_descText: Fetches the transaction status for a given partnerTransId, useful for rechecking after user authentication, tailored for acquirer integrations.

acqUpwWait_headers_authorization: Authorization (string, required): The authorization key for the acquirer.

acqUpwWait_params_table_partnerTransId_d: Unique identifier of the partner transaction.

acqUpwWait_params_rule_acquirerId: Required, provided in headers as acquirerid or x-acq-id.

vt_intro: This endpoint allows an acquirer to void a successful Alipay transaction on the same day (Colombo time) it was completed, updating the transaction status and notifying relevant parties from an acquirer-centric perspective.
vt_endpoint_description: Voids a successful transaction if requested on the same Colombo calendar day as the original payment.
vt_headers_item_acquirerId: acquirerid or x-acq-id (string, required): The unique identifier of the acquirer.
vt_headers_item_authorization: Authorization (string, required): The authorization key for the acquirer.
vt_headers_item_authKey: Auth-Key (string, required): The authentication key for the acquirer.
vt_requestBody_intro: The request body must be in JSON format and include the following parameters
vt_requestBody_table_transactionId_desc: Unique identifier of the transaction to void.
vt_requestBody_table_outletId_desc: Unique identifier of the outlet associated with the transaction.
vt_requestBody_rule_acquirerId: Required, provided in headers as acquirerid or x-acq-id.

marketing_card_multi_desc: Process globally and show discounts in each customer’s local currency—automatically.
marketing_card_top_desc: As your transaction volume grows, your commission rate goes down.
marketing_card_social_desc: We promote our merchants across social channels and on SriPay-integrated business sites for extra reach.

mao_code_202_desc: The request has been accepted for processing, but the operation is not yet complete.
mao_code_204_desc: The request was successful but there is no content to return.
mao_code_400_desc: The request was malformed or missing required parameters.

mao_code_403_desc: The authenticated user does not have permission to perform this action.

mao_code_409_desc: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.
wfo_sections_step1: Merchant Web Frame for Online Payment
wfo_title: Merchant Web Frame for Online Payment
wfo_intro: The SriPay Connect Merchant Web Frame is a unified, secure, and responsive payment interface designed to simplify the online payment experience for merchants and customers alike. This dynamic payment frame aggregates multiple payment options into a single integration, reducing complexity and accelerating time-to-market.
wfo_overview_desc: Merchants can integrate a single API endpoint into their website or web store to enable a complete suite of online payment methods without the need for multiple gateways or configurations.
wfo_feat1_desc_part1: Supports a wide range of payment methods including
wfo_feat2_note_msg: Alipay+ Online is available for USD transactions only
wfo_feat4_desc_part2: infrastructure with tokenization and end-to-end encryption, ensuring the highest level of data security.
wfo_feat5_desc: Fully mobile optimized to ensure smooth checkout experiences across devices.
wfo_benefit_1: Reduce integration overhead and developer workload
wfo_benefit_4: Lower maintenance with unified backend architecture
wfo_benefit_5: Future-ready with support for upcoming payment methods
cpo_title: Card Payments For Online (Visa, Mastercard, Union Pay)
cpo_intro: SriPay Connect offers seamless online card payment acceptance through a unified interface, enabling merchants to accept Visa, Mastercard, UnionPay, and American Express (Amex) cards with a single integration.
cpo_overview_body: Our online card payment solution is designed for high performance, security, and flexibility, supporting both LKR and USD currencies. With built-in compliance and fraud protection, merchants can confidently offer card payments to local and international customers.

mocpq.title: Order Code Pay QR
mocpq.intro: The Order Code Pay option allows the merchant to generate a dynamic QR code and display it to the customer for payment. The merchant then receives the payment result in real time. The following API specifies the criteria required to initiate the request.

items.merchantId: merchantId or x-mch-id (string, required): The unique identifier of the merchant.
items.authorization: Authorization or x-api-key (string, required): The unique identifier Key of the merchant.

requestBody.title: Request Body
requestBody.intro: The request body must be in JSON format and include the following parameters

amount.validation: Must be a positive number greater than 0.

subject.validation: Must be a string, max length 100 characters.

currency.validation: Must be either USD or LKR.

rules.amount: Required, must be a positive number (greater than 0).
rules.subject: Required, string with a maximum length of 100 characters.
rules.currency: Required, must be one of USD or LKR.

errors.title: Error Responses
errors.intro: Below are the possible error responses, including their status codes, error codes, and messages:

items.outletNotApprovedAplusOffline: 8. Outlet Not Approved for Alipay+ Offline
items.terminalNotApproved: 9. Terminal Not Approved or Not Found

notes.n1: The endpoint interacts with Alipay's API to generate a QR code for offline transactions.
notes.n2: The merchantId can be provided in the headers as either merchantid or x-mch-id.
notes.n3: The generated QR code URLs are returned in the allPicUrls object, including payment QR, big, small, and medium-sized images.
notes.n4: The outTradeNo is a unique identifier for the Alipay order, stored in the database for reference.

ocrll.title: Order Code Result Listener
ocrll.intro: This endpoint establishes a real-time connection using Server-Sent Events (SSE) to listen for updates on Alipay+ transactions identified by outTradeNo. It streams transaction status changes, converting timestamps from GMT+8 to Asia/Colombo (GMT+5:30).

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.desc: Provides real-time updates on the transaction status for a specific outTradeNo using SSE.

headers.title: Headers
headers.merchantId: merchantId or x-mch-id (string, required): The unique identifier of the merchant.
headers.auth: Authorization or x-api-key (string, required): The unique identifier Key of the merchant.

reqParams.title: Request Parameters
reqParams.intro: The request includes a path parameter

table.rowOutTradeNoDesc: Unique identifier of the Alipay+ transaction.

reqParams.ruleOutTradeNo: Required, must be a non-empty string.

success.title: Success Response
success.bul1: event: update - Indicates a transaction update.
success.bul2: data: JSON array containing transaction details (id, trade_status, timestamp).

errors.title: Error Responses
errors.intro: Below are the possible error responses, including their status codes, error codes, and messages:

notes.title: Notes
notes.n1: The endpoint uses SSE to maintain a persistent connection, streaming updates from the Alipay+ Instore Transactions.
notes.n2: Timestamps (gmt_payment) are converted from GMT+8 to Asia/Colombo (GMT+5:30).
notes.n3: A heartbeat message (:\n\n) is sent every 30 seconds to keep the connection alive.
notes.n4: The connection closes automatically when a transaction update is received or an error occurs, and it cleans up resources on client disconnect.

uppw.title: User Present Pay Waiting
uppw.intro: This endpoint retrieves the status of a user-presented Alipay transaction awaiting authentication, identified by partnerTransId. It allows rechecking to verify if user authentication has occurred, returning the latest transaction details.

endpoint.title: Endpoint
endpoint.desc: Fetches the transaction status for a given partnerTransId, useful for rechecking after user authentication.

headers.title: Headers
headers.merchantId: merchantId or x-mch-id (string, required): The unique identifier of the merchant.
headers.auth: Authorization or x-api-key (string, required): The unique identifier Key of the merchant.

reqParams.title: Request Parameters
reqParams.intro: The request includes a path parameter

table.rowPartnerDesc: Unique identifier of the partner transaction.

reqParams.rulePartner: Required, must be a non-empty string.

errors.title: Error Responses
errors.intro: Below are the possible error responses, including their status codes, error codes, and messages:

notes.title: Notes
notes.n1: This endpoint queries the Alipay Transactions to retrieve transaction details based on partnerTransId.
notes.n2: The response includes transactionId, timestamp, currency, amount, outletName, outletId, transactionStatus, and paymentMethod.
notes.n3: Use this endpoint to recheck the transaction status after initiating a payment via /userpresent-pay, especially when awaiting user authentication.
notes.n4: The timestamp reflects the time in Asia/Colombo (GMT+5:30).
notes.n5: If the transaction status is still pending, repeated calls can be made to check for updates after user authentication.

paymentRequest.intro: This endpoint creates a WebFrame payment request for a merchant, generating a unique payment link with a 24-hour expiry. It automatically includes enabled payment methods (e.g., Alipay+ or cards) based on the outlet's approved status, redirecting users to a payment method selection page.
